node.title: NASA is outraged by an anti-satellite missile test. Russia's downplaying the whole thing
node.alt: A grainy photo of the International Space Station
node.description: The head of Russia's space agency is due to meet with NASA representatives over the incident, which put International Space Station astronauts on alert.Â
node.content:
["On Monday, the astronauts working on the International Space Station were woken up and told to take shelter \u2014 the station could potentially be hit by a cloud of space debris.", "Thankfully no major incidents were reported, but US officials are very unhappy.\u00a0", "Here's why.", "
What actually happened?
", "A Russian\u00a0satellite called\u00a0Kosmos 1408 was blown up, with the explosion generating a cloud of space junk.", "NASA says there are more than 1,500 pieces of trackable orbital debris, but it's estimated there could be hundreds of thousands of tiny pieces now orbiting the Earth.", "The crew aboard the International Space Station were woken up and told to close the hatches to certain modules on the station as it approached the cloud of debris, just in case the pieces caused any damage.\u00a0", "NASA says crew took\u00a0shelter\u00a0in their docked\u00a0spacecraft\u00a0capsules for about two hours.\u00a0", "Those spacecraft can be used like lifeboats, which would allow the crew to escape back to\u00a0Earth in an emergency situation.\u00a0", "
Was it definitely Russia?
", "US State Department spokesman Ned Price said the explosion was caused by Russia testing\u00a0a \"direct ascent anti-satellite missile\" against one of its own satellites.\u00a0", "He came out swinging against Russia, calling the test reckless and\u00a0destructive and said it created space debris that \"risks astronauts' lives, the integrity of the International Space Station, and the interests of all nations\".", "NASA administrator Bill Nelson said he was \"outraged\".", "\"With its long and storied history in human spaceflight, it is unthinkable that Russia would endanger not only the American and international partner astronauts on the ISS, but also their own cosmonauts,\" he said.\u00a0", "But Russia has been downplaying the whole thing.", "Russian\u00a0space agency Roscosmos tweeted:", "\u2026 but it hasn't posted anything confirming it was a satellite missile test.\u00a0", "Russia's state media reported Roscosmos's director-general\u00a0Dmitry Rogozin would meet with NASA representatives on Tuesday.\u00a0", "Meanwhile, Russian cosmonaut\u00a0Anton Shkaplerov has tweeted that it's business as usual up in space.\u00a0", "\"Friends, everything is regular with us! We continue to work on the program,\" he said.\u00a0", "
How do you shoot a satellite in space?
", "You need an\u00a0anti-satellite (ASAT) weapon, which is a\u00a0high-tech space weapon\u00a0that can, as the name suggests,\u00a0shoot down satellites.", "Some are launched from the ground but others can be in orbit up in space.\u00a0", "It's long been forecast that\u00a0space would eventually become a very important domain for warfare thanks to an increased\u00a0reliance on satellites for things such as GPS, telecommunications and weather forecasting.\u00a0", "You can imagine how taking out just the right satellite could affect a technology-dependent military's defences.\u00a0", "So far,\u00a0only the US, Russia, China and India have demonstrated the ability to shoot down their own satellites.", "
What happens to the debris?
", "Harvard astronomer Jonathan McDowell said the first few pieces of debris would probably\u00a0start to fall back into the atmosphere within a few months.", "But he said it could take as long as\u00a010 years for the cloud to completely clear up.\u00a0", "
What has everyone else done about it?
", "Besides posting a few angry tweets, firing off a few sternly-worded letters and meeting with Russia's space agency boss, not a lot.\u00a0", "US Secretary of State Antony Blinken posted on Twitter that he condemned the test:", "The US hasn't made any public threats against Russia, unless you count this vague comment from Mr Price:", "\"We are going to continue to make very clear that we won't tolerate this kind of activity,\" he said.\u00a0", "It's highly unlikely any retaliation would happen in space, with just\u00a0a single\u00a0fleck of paint having the ability to do major damage when orbiting at 28,000 kilometres per hour.", "And Mr Nelson said the US and Russia\u00a0needed to cooperate to keep the International Space Station running.", "\"I don't want it to be threatened,\" he said.", "\"You've got to operate it together.\"", "ABC with Wires\u00a0"]
